tutorial.title: Cleaning Services Page
tutorial.descriptionContent: Dynamically adjust this cleaning service's webpage with queries and events

files.name: index.html
files.content:
AllN1 Domestic Services

Welcome to our site! Use the buttons below to choose which home services you want to know more about. When the services appear, add them to your list and we will be happy to arrange an estimate for you.

Lawn and Garden

Cleaning

Estimates Requested

  • Lawn and Garden
  • Cleaning

files.name: style.css
script.js

executableContent.instructions:
We want to permanently hide the banner image when any of the three top buttons are clicked. Since we'll use this functionality for all three buttons, we can simplify our code by using just one function. Don't worry about the buttons not working as we add our code. They'll work once we add all of the event listeners at the end.

1. Write an empty function named `hideBanner`.
2. Use `getElementByID()` to select the banner.
3. In the same line, set the banner `display` property to `"none"`.

files.name: style.css
script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: `display` is part of the HTML element's `style` properties. You can access both `style` and `display` through dot notation.

executableContent.instructions:
We need to make the `Outside` button work. The content inside the `.outsideServices` class is hidden by the `.hide` class. Let's select `.outsideServices` and remove its `.hide` class. To do this, we'll use `querySelectorAll()` so that we can get a bit more practice.

1. Select the `.outsideServices` class by using `querySelectorAll()` and assign it to a `const` variable named `outsideServices` .
2. Write an empty function named `showOutside()` .
3. Inside the empty function invoke the `hideBanner` function.
4. Access the zero index of the `outsideServices` variable and use the `classList` property to remove the `hide` class.

files.name: style.css
script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Use the syntax `outsideServices[0].classlist.remove()` for the final task. In the parentheses, you'l need to add the class targeted for removal.

executableContent.instructions:
We need to make the `Inside` button work. We'll do it in a similar way to the previous lesson, but this time we'll use `getElementsByClassName()`.

1. Select the `.insideServices` class by using `getElementsByClassName()` and assign it to a `const` named `insideServices` .
2. Write an empty function named `showInside` .
3. Inside the empty function invoke the `hideBanner` function.
4. Access the zero index of the `insideServices` variable using bracket notation and use the `classList` property to remove the `hide` class.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Using `getElementsByClassName()` means we don't need to add a `.` before the class name in parentheses.

executableContent.instructions:
We now need to make the `All` button work. Because we already wrote functions to show the inside and outside services, which both call `hideBanner()`, we only need to invoke all of these functions when clicking `All`.

1. Write an empty function named `showAll()`.
2. Inside the empty function, invoke the `showOutside()` function.
2. Inside the function, invoke the `showInside()` function.

executableContent.instructions:
The portion of the website that shows that an estimate request has been sent is also hidden. We need to add code that will reveal it when a service is selected.

1. Select the `h3` tag using `querySelector` , and assign it to a `const` variable named `estimateBanner` .
2. Write an empty function named `showEstimateBanner` .
3. Inside the empty function use the `estimateBanner` variable and the `classList` property to remove the `hide` class from the element.

executableContent.instructions:
We also need to display the button that clears the estimates list. It's also hidden with the `.hide` class.

1. Write an empty function named `showClearButton`.
2. Inside the empty function, use the `clearEstimateButton` variable and the `classList` property to remove the `.hide` class.

files.name: style.css
script.js

executableContent.instructions:
We need to make the `Add` button function for the Lawn and Garden services. Clicking the button will reveal the `h3` element, the `Clear` button, and notes that a lawn estimate has been requested. All of these elements are hidden because of the `.hide` class. 

At the end, we'll also change the Lawn and Garden photo by setting a different attribute.

1. Use `getElementById()` to select the element with the ID `#lawnPhoto`. Assign the value to a `const` variable called `lawnPhoto` .
2. Use the `querySelector()` method to select the element with the ID `#lawnEstimate`. Assign it to a `const` variable called `lawnEstimate` .
3. Write an empty function called `addLawn()`. 
4. Inside the empty function invoke the `showEstimateBanner` function.
5. Next, also invoke the `showClearButton` function.
6. Remove the `.hide` class from the element targeted by the `lawnEstimate` variable. Use `classList` to do this.
7. Use the `setAttribute` method on the element targeted by the `lawnPhoto` variable and set the `src` to the following: 
```js
https://mimo.app/i/piggy-bank.png
```

files.content:
AllN1 Domestic Services

Welcome to our site! Use the buttons below to choose which home services you want to know more about. When the services appear, add them to your list and we will be happy to arrange an estimate for you.

files.name: style.css
script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
- Remember, you don't need to add `#` in parentheses when using `getElementById()` with IDs.
- Remember, you do need to add `#` in parentheses when using `querySelector()` with IDs.
- To set the attribute use `lawnPhoto.setAttribute()` . Inside the parentheses, you'll have to add the targeted attribute, followed by the new link provided to you.

executableContent.instructions:
We also need to make the `Add` button work. The code logic will be very similar to the previous lesson.

1. Use `querySelector()` to select the element with the ID of`#cleaningPhoto`. Assign the result to a `const` variable called `cleaningPhoto` .
2. Use `querySelector()` to select the element with the class set to `cleaningEstimate`. Assign the result to a `const` variable called `cleaningEstimate` .
3. Write an empty function called `addCleaning()`. 
4. Inside the empty function invoke the `showEstimateBanner()` function.
5. Invoke the `showClearButton()` function.
6. Remove the `hide` class from the element targeted by the `cleaningEstimate` variable. Use `.classList` to do this.
7. Use the `setAttribute` method with the element targeted by the `cleaningPhoto` variable and set the `src` to the following;
```js
https://mimo.app/i/piggy-bank.png
```

files.name: style.css
script.js

executableContent.instructions:
Next up, we need the ability to clear the estimates request. To do that, we'll hide:
  - the `h3` element that contains the text `Estimates Requested`,
  - the `Clear Estimates` button.
  - and the `li` elements used to show the request, 

We'll also revert the photos of the selected services to the original photos.


1. Create an empty function called `clearEstimate()`.
2. Use the `classList` property to hide the element selected by the `estimateBanner` variable. Do so by adding the `hide` class.
3. Use `classList` to hide the element selected by the `clearEstimateButton` variable.
4. Change the src of the `lawnPhoto` using dot notation to `https://mimo.app/i/colorful-flowers.png`,
5. Change the src of the `cleaningPhoto` using dot notation to `https://mimo.app/i/cleaning.png`.
